entry.title: CrOS GMC V2: Allow tab key event to scroll pages
entry.content:
MediaScrollView in QuickSettingsMediaView is a views::ScrollView but it

does not have horizontal/vertical scroll bars and its scrolling is

controlled by PaginationModel. The tab key event can navigate to focus a

UI element on a media view that is not in the front, so we need to

automatically scroll to that page for accessibility reason.



This requires us to override the ScrollRectToVisible() function in

ScrollView::Viewport to handle it in MediaScrollView instead.



Bug: 1451016

Change-Id: I2614d5e3568d2967e0598b841367db822fbaa9b8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4703019

Commit-Queue: Yiren Wang

Reviewed-by: Scott Violet

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1173769}

entry.title: Revert "Don't bounds-check a history API navigation's offset in the renderer"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 758e5e482e7cbbfd64073768da3f24c2788ffa42.



Reason for revert: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1466474



Original change's description:

> Don't bounds-check a history API navigation's offset in the renderer

>

> When a history API navigation occurs (e.g., history.go(-2)), we

> currently check whether the given offset is in-bounds before sending

> the navigation to the browser. The spec and WPT expect an async step

> to occur (i.e., going to the browser) so that we can take into

> account any pending back/forward navigations in offset calculation.

>

> However, when a history API navigation begins, we pause virtual time

> if the navigation is in-bounds only. If we can't check that in

> the renderer, we need of notifying the renderer that a history API

> navigation was out of bounds so that we can unpause virtual time.

> Add a case to the TraverseCancelled() message to unpause virtual

> time and call it for out-of-bounds history API navigations.

> (Note that TraverseCancelled() is currently only used for navigation

> API traversals, but there's nothing stopping us from using the same

> plumbing for this case).

>

> This change gives us the correct behavior when history.back()

> and history.forward() are called in rapid succession while at the

> front of the back/forward list. The forward() should be calculated

> from the pending entry for the back() navigation, resulting in

> the two navigations cancelling each other out. The renderer doesn't

> know what the pending offset is, so it thinks the forward() is trying

> to go out-of-bounds and incorrectly rejects that navigation.

>

> Change-Id: I36bfbe8211df5cad9f6cefeee659514299805434

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4496257

> Reviewed-by: Nasko Oskov

> Commit-Queue: Nate Chapin

> Reviewed-by: Andrey Kosyakov

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1138110}

entry.title: Fix content analysis for drag and drop from outlook.
entry.content:
When the user drags and drops attachments from the outlook native app,

chrome receives "virtual" files and not real files. Chrome contains

code to convert these virtual files to real files to allow for drag

and drop to work, but this was happening after the content analysis.

This means that the analysis did not include these files.



This CL causes the drag and drop code to convert the virtual files

before the analysis is performed so they can be included in the

analysis. This CL also does some cleanup of the OnPerformDropContext

and AsyncDropNavigationObserver classes. Both were used to maintain

state across async operations and had duplicate fields. The fields

are now consolidated in OnPerformDropContext.

entry.title: [dPWA] Refactor WebAppUninstallDialog
entry.content:
Previously, the WebAppUninstallDialog had a very weird ownership

model, where the dialog triggerer and the view would own a raw_ptr of

each other, seeming so that each can close the other based on edge

cases like profile shut down, multiple dialogs running for the same

app etc. This CL aims to clean the code up by:



1. Removing web_app_dialog_manager, and moving everything to web_app_ui_manager_impl. The dialog manager interface is no longer

needed, since the web_app_ui_manager interface acts as a bridge

between c/b/web_applications and c/b/ui/web_applications/.



2. Removing the dialog_shown_for_testing implementation. If needed,

the WidgetShownWaiter test implementation can be used to wait for the

dialog to be shown.



3. The triggerer no longer owns the view, thus removing dangling pointers and complying with how other views code in the web_apps

system behaves. The views code observes web app installations and

other pending uninstallations, and closes itself automatically instead

of holding a dangling pointer to the trigger.



Verified manually and by running the browser tests to ensure no new

dangling pointers have been introduced.



Bug: b/291277063

Change-Id: I675ced66cc1a6556c4b99cdaa7dc5fa2dac5cd6a

entry.title: MP4 Muxer: Implement OnEncodedVideo for muxer.
entry.content:
Muxer creates MP4 boxes with the information on OnEncodedVideo

API call. It creates Movie and its children, fragment.



1. It caculcate the duration with the first and last call of

OnEncodedVideo, and uses timescale for duration TimeDelta.

2. It calculate sample duration by using the current sample

minus the prior sample.

3. Every fragment ('moof') box will be created with key frame.

(In Windows, 100 samples are in single fragment).

4. It uses input code_descriptions for 'avcC' box.

5. For test, it uses MP4StreamParser to parse the created data,

which will validate it. It also uses BoxReader to validate

respective box validation.



Bug: 1072056

Change-Id: Iaa4e45ba793b63bc32610c5decb746f30e694b19

entry.title: Revert "vaapi: Remove usage of GL and libva-x11."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 7bc1edf3ef1d8ebb9c73bd5abe50299f7fe1f2c8.



Reason for revert: Caused crbug.com/1466825



Original change's description:

> vaapi: Remove usage of GL and libva-x11.

>

> This CL removes the usage of GL stuff and the X11 libva API in the

> VaapiWrapper in favor of always using libva-drm with no awareness of the

> rendering API. This is possible now that we got rid of the legacy

> VaapiVideoDecodeAccelerator code.

>

> This has a few benefits:

>

> 1) Simplifies the VADisplayStateSingleton initialization since we can

> use the same path for ChromeOS and Linux.

>

> 2) VaapiWrapper won't know and won't care about whether we use GL,

> Vulkan, ANGLE or any combination thereof. That's abstracted already

> by the SharedImage framework.

>

> 3) It will make it easier to get Linux to work with out-of-process video

> decoding (OOP-VD).

>

> Bug: 1326754

> Test: HW decode acceleration works with CHROME_DEVEL_SANDBOX="${HOME}/chrome/chrome_sandbox" DISPLAY=:1.0 ~/chrome/chrome --user-data-dir=${HOME}/.chrome_dev_data --enable-features=VaapiVideoDecodeLinuxGL --disable-features=Vulkan --v=1 "https://crosvideo.appspot.com/?codec=h264&resolution=720&mute=true"

> Change-Id: Ic3a959e35fc9dadfa654e7d07c1c4cfcf8d39a07

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4697513

> Reviewed-by: Miguel Casas-Sanchez

> Reviewed-by: Pilar Molina Lopez

> Commit-Queue: Andres Calderon Jaramillo

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1172563}



Bug: 1326754

Change-Id: I52a5e7efe2af29a9c97a2480dd02554e0b8d9cba

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4705391

entry.title: Printing: Fix float truncation in a page size calculation function
entry.content:
With https://crrev.com/1160870, a large portion of printing code uses

floats to do calculations. Some parts of the code still use integer

units, and GetPageSizeAndContentAreaFromPageLayout() does one of the

conversions to integer units. Here, it adds up the content area and the

margins to get the page size. This can result in value truncdoes one of

the conversions to integer units. Here, it adds up the content area and

the margins to get the page size. This can result in value truncation,

where the numbers adds up to 612, but the float representation is

611.999. That goes into a gfx::Size and gets stored as 611.



Fix this issue by storing the dimensions as floats, and then converting

to integer values using gfx::ToRoundedSize() and gfx::ToEnclosedRect().



Bug: 1466713

Change-Id: I91eb004069dcc215e74b84e5a3e911a16ad9874d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4707205

entry.title: FSA: Cache the FSAManager mojo connection in the renderer
entry.content:
The mojom::blink::FileSystemAccessManager interface will soon be used

to mint new FileSystemObserver objects. This requires a Manager object

whose lifetime is tied to the lifetime of the frame (as opposed to

constructing a new Manager on-demand for each entry point to the FSA

API, as we do now)



Also ties the manager to the Storage task source, as per recent

updates to the spec https://fs.spec.whatwg.org/

entry.title: [dPWA] Field trial configs for MLInstallabilityPromoter
entry.content:
This CL introduces the field trial configs for the MLInstallability

promotion experiment to start.



This caused failures in sites where the ManifestParser returns an

empty start_url even if the manifest is non-empty. Investigation

brought up that maybe the manifest parser is not parsing start URLs

fully according to the spec, but the behavior might be intentional for it to be handled further down the callstack (as otherwise there is no signal about the existence or non-existence of the start_url).



A comment is added to manifest.mojom so that it can be investigated

later on.



Bug: b/289047366, crbug.com/1466327

$ git log 0cf55911a..f45df57a4 --date=short --no-merges --format='%ad %ae %s'

2023-07-21 wub Internal change

2023-07-20 quiche-dev Modifying the "rsa_blinder" in at crypto library to take in a boolean that indicates whether RSA public exponent should be used for computations during the execution of the blind RSA signature with public metadata protocol. The rest of the files only change their calls to the RsaBlinder::New to build correctly.

2023-07-20 quiche-dev Modifying the "TestSignWithPublicMetadata" test function take in a boolean that indicates whether RSA public exponent should be used for computations.

2023-07-20 wub Internal change

2023-07-20 quiche-dev Modifying the "CreatePublicKeyRSAWithPublicMetadata" functions in Crypto library to take in a boolean that indicates whether RSA public exponent should be used for computations. These functions are used in our clients.

2023-07-20 danzh Fix QuicSpdyStream to allow "host" header in response header according to https://github.com/envoyproxy/envoy/issues/9873. Also rename ValidatedRequestHeaders() to ValidatedReceivedHeaders().

2023-07-20 bnc Rename WriteResult::set_batch_id() argument.

2023-07-19 quiche-dev Comment out a test case which uses a will-be-invalid URL temporarily

2023-07-19 quiche-dev Modifying the "rsa_blind_signer" in at crypto library to take in a boolean that indicates whether RSA public exponent should be used for computations during the execution of the partially blind RSA signature protocol. The rest of the files only change their calls to the RsaBlindSigner::New to build correctly.

2023-07-19 quiche-dev Changing names of two functions so that the names are more descriptive,

2023-07-19 peiwenhu Add a function to directly consume the plaintext data in response.

2023-07-19 bnc Clear QuicSpdyStreamBodyManager in QuicSpdyStream::CloseReadSide().

2023-07-19 haoyuewang Make QuicSpdyStream::ReadableBytes & QuicSpdyStream::HasBytesToRead consistent by relying on the BodyManager for IETF QUIC.

2023-07-19 quiche-dev Adding test vectors for Partially Blind Rsa Signatures that are correct for the protocol that does not use the rsa public exponent during public metadata exponent derivations.

2023-07-18 vasilvv Switch //third_party/charon/stream to use QuicGenericSession instead of QuicTransportSession.

2023-07-17 bnc Change QuicTagToString() to be independent of locale.

entry.title: Convert coordinates correctly when retargeting a located event.
entry.content:
Previously, we converted the event location assuming it was in the

source SubmenuView's coordinate space. But the callers' events are

actually in the SubmenuView's root view's coordinate space, which is

slightly different (basically, off by a few pixels vertically).



This fixes child view targeting in nested submenus.

entry.title: Fix crash when a tab is replaced (e.g. discarded) before a drag starts.
entry.content:
A replaced tab has its WebContents swapped out for another, but TabDragController uses WebContents pointers as unique identifiers for tabs.



Two fixes for this: first, the DraggedTabsClosedTracker meant to handle this during drags is extended to the before-start period where there is no attached_context_. Second, as more of a failsafe, when starting a drag, if any tab or header cannot be found, the drag is canceled.



Also added a new integration test covering this issue. With only the first fix, or both fixes, the drag can continue through a discard, and the new test passes. With only the failsafe fix, the drag is canceled by a discard, and the new test fails. With neither fix, the new test crashes.



See related CLs:

crrev.com/c/1536539, which added the DraggedTabsClosedTracker

crrev.com/c/2443976, which demoted this bug from a UAF to a CHECK



Bug: 1445776

entry.title: Convert ListScanners to async discovery
entry.content:
If asynchronous discovery is enabled, switch ListScanners to wrap an

asynchronous discovery session instead of doing a synchronous d-bus

call. This allows lorgnette to download DLC backends without extending

the already-long ListScanners handler. The new implementation

accumulates the results in its signal handler until all local devices

have been enumerated. Because ListScanners gets a point-in-time list,

the discovery session is torn down as soon as all local scanners have

been enumerated. The end result passed to the callback of ListScanners

is exactly the same as before.



Bug: b:277049005

Test: Run Scan app in BLD lab and verify returned scanners

entry.title: Make network service sandbox be AppContainer not LPAC, for now.
entry.content:
This CL adds a new feature (disabled by default) that determines

whether or not LPAC is enabled for the network service sandbox.



It has been determined that Network Location Awareness service

requires ALL APPLICATION PACKAGES (AppContainer) rather than

ALL RESTRICTED APPLICATION PACKAGES (LPAC) to connect to it,

causing GetNetworkList to fail.



This CL adds a temporaily weaker sandbox in order to make progress

on other network service sandbox blockers.



This feature will be enabled again once GetNetworkList has been

proxied out via mojo.



BUG=1450754

entry.title: Fix crash in ContentAnalysisDialog.
entry.content:
The visibility of this dialog is delayed by 1 second to prevent flashes

when content analysis scans are quick. The dialog posts a delayed task

that trigger the dialog to be shown. This tasks accepts a weak pointer

to the dialog.



When an analysis scan returns a verdict while the dialog visibility is

pending, a `DeleteSoon` task is posted. Usually this runs before the

pending visibility task, in which case all is fine. However, if this

runs after visibility task, the dialog delegate is deleted while the

dialog's widget is still using the delegate, causing a crash.



The fix is to set a boolean member in the dialog once `DeleteSoon` is

called, which other delayed tasks in the dialog cause use to abort

early.



Bug: b:287498390

Change-Id: I55468943fe4b0b47964991ace1b3db4eb8e7dec6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4705011

entry.title: Warn on duplicate test names
entry.content:
In certain unpredictable circumstances duplicate test names can cause

the test launcher to crash. Duplicate test names can also cause

confusion about exactly which test has failed, and presumably

complicate tracking of test failures over time. This change adds

checking for duplicate test names to make them visible.



Testing of this change found many duplicate test names, usually caused

by copy/paste. All of these have now been fixed.



Bug: 1465008

entry.title: Quick delete: Refactor quick delete to MVC pattern
entry.content:
This CL refactors the existing quick delete component to migrate using

the MVC pattern. Previously, quick delete dialog was static and

therefore it didn't require listening to background changes. However,

now we have added time spinner which triggers changes to the dialog.

In future, there may be more points which would trigger changes.

Therefore, we need to move to MVC pattern to accommodate them.



This CL also adds new tests for the new files. Note, that many tests checking the view change inside QuickDeleteDialogDelegateUnitTest

are moved to QuickDeleteViewBinderTest.



UX: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ZxjByDduRhVEHxf-MMA5hUWUoidlz80Z/view?usp=sharing



Bug: b/290165055, 1412087

Change-Id: Ia4c2fd6b6dc457402be942d2c7855b995b99c092

entry.title: Enable building rust_gtest_interop_unittests on iOS
entry.content:
We don't want to run them there yet, as they will fail due to

https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1466674



But we can still compile them. This will help guard regressions

as we work to fix their execution.



There's a bunch of places in testing/buildbot/test_suites.pyl

that could be made to run the tests now, but this will be done

separately.



When Blink is not enabled on iOS, unit tests use a separate unit

test launcher implementation that does not use base::TestLauncher

at all. Remove the include of test_launcher.h in this build config

and remove all the stuff from the header that is not used/defined

in unit_test_launcher_ios.cc.



Then rework the logic in rust_gtest_interop_unittests main() fn

so that it correctly observes the number of tests run on iOS as

well as other platforms.



Bug: 1386212, 1466674

Change-Id: I2fd79ab910a8bc466fd068308df8dd67bdbf37a0

entry.title: WebUI: Include test file name in WebUIMochaBrowserTest summary error.
entry.content:
This makes it easier to differentiate between test failures, especially

when filing bugs during gardening, or via scripts.



Previously it would say:

Tests are failing: web_ui_mocha_browser_test.cc(123): Failed\nMocha test failures detected.



After it will say something as follows:

Tests are failing: web_ui_mocha_browser_test.cc(123): Failed\nMocha test failures detected in file: cr_elements/cr_button_test.js, triggered by 'mocha.run()'

entry.title: Align MV Tiles with Header text
entry.content:
The change ensures MV tile text is vertically aligned with Header text

in Phase 2 enabled scenarios.



The change ensures that the fading effect on tablets is aligned with

the edge of the scroll area.



Screenshots:

- Default visuals: http://screen/3Pjv9ocVd5zaZMR.png

- Modern/regular: http://screen/57gVXUWkaGGZejk.png

- Modern/smaller: http://screen/9UdpYGSxhx6rxNG.png

- Modern/smallest: http://screen/TBW7qT9Ci777fnP.png

- Regular/tablet: http://screen/JzZzgbmNUDAvmqS.png

- Regular/Fading/tablet: http://screen/37B5KRHx7v73RSM.png

- Modern/tablet: http://screen/3nrUjSoB3oNLaU6.png

- Modern/Fading/tablet: http://screen/7FR4cxh6eFqYsmX.png

RTL

- Default visuals: http://screen/4iTiubB4XQK73vR.png

- Modern/regular: http://screen/7yEjnRLwK7DczLu.png

- Modern/smaller: http://screen/BFRVuKUNJWiD7Ff.png

- Modern/smallest: http://screen/9asovrgqiGTtL3P.png

- Regular/tablet: http://screen/5XrLhcUMBHXDwAp.png

- Regular/Fading/tablet: http://screen/8aPKYW4rTLkz3zW.png

- Modern/tablet: http://screen/Uu4bYGn2N2pZsLW.png

- Modern/Fading/tablet: http://screen/4AeAMwowHUGiTAN.png



Note: if the MV tile text is not filling up entire space, it will not

align exactly to the header text -- this is why cases like

"Amazon.co..." do visually align, but "Wikipedia" does not:

http://screen/42GxYQCfteb7z39.png

entry.title: Improve handling of the devicechange event
entry.content:
Now the event is fired on a Web page only when the result of

enumerateDevices() would change.



This CL contains:

* Changes to MediaDevices in Blink, so that the devicechange event is

fired only when the page-visible enumeration results change (ignoring

group ID changes).



* A fix for TranslateMediaDeviceInfoArray() which is used to send the

updated enumeration results from the browser to the renderer when a

device change notification occurs.



* A new test for functions in media_devices_util.h, which contains

utilities used to generate device enumerations, including the patched

TranslateMediaDeviceInfoArray().



Bug: 1462957

Change-Id: I4b4a9b95601990f365710f7d81b0a3c6118df82d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4700826

entry.title: Support removing media-device salts with Clear-Site-Data cookies
entry.content:
This CL removes DATA_TYPE_MEDIA_DEVICE_SALTS and moves salt

deletion to be part of cookie deletion and not DOM Storage deletion.



The reason is that media-device salts are more like cookies than

DOM Storage. The main reason salts were treated as DOM storage was

UI integration for per-site removal, but this is no longer necessary

thanks to the integration of salts with BrowsingDataModel.



This CL also adds a test to verify that the "Clear-Site-Data: cookies"

header resets device IDs for that site.



Bug: 1410462

Change-Id: I8f5fabff264aa2871ae78cc171a7f75c6d2fa558

entry.title: arc/gio: Move display overlay views as transient windows
entry.content:
This CL

- changes the architecture of the display overlay UIs.

- supports the game dashboard menu functions.



EditingList, ButtonOptionsMenu, ButtonLabelList and InputMappingView

have their own widgets and they are created as transient windows

so they won't be recorded under window level. Since they have their

own separate widget, so they are not bounded to a single rectangle

and more flexibility to move outside of the window.

entry.title: [Start Surface] Fix single tab card thumbnail try 2
entry.content:
The previous fix assumed that the measured width and height of the

SingleTabView were already set prior to the thumbnail being loaded.



However, if the view is not already measured OR the view size changes

it is necessary to update the thumbnail's matrix.



For this to fail previously

* Thumbnail cache refactor

* Thumbnail placeholder

needed to be enabled.

entry.title: WebNN: Decouple adapter from command recorder.
entry.content:
This change makes our DML backend object model 1:1 with DML. There was indirection because relationships mismatched. DML adapters have no direct relationship with queues and command recording isn't dependent on the DML adapter.



* Moves device-specific methods off of the adapter.

* Passes {queue, device} directly instead of adapter indirection.

* Makes Queue ref-counted to ensure the recorder outlives it.



Bug: 1273291

Change-Id: I1413f0f4f70c9f7b095029e10804f04fc6bbcfa5

entry.title: ash: Refactor `DeskBarBoundsAnimation`
entry.content:
This CL removes the self-deleting class `DeskBarBoundsAnimation` and

replaces it with the function `AnimateDeskBarBounds`. The CL does

not change the functionality of the code.



This is [2/X] CL, and the goal is to rewrite all desk bar related

animations to use animation builder with abort handle.

entry.title: Fix AuthFactorConfig::IsConfigured(kPin)
entry.content:
The function did not consider legacy pref-based PINs. The

PinFactorEditor::RemovePin call had a similar problem: The function is

supposed to be no-op if no PIN is configured, so it returns immediately

when no PIN is configured. However, it didn't consider pref-based PINs,

so the function would not remove a pref-based PIN.



The fix is tested by changes to OSSettingsPinSetupTest cases:



- All tests are now run for both pref-based and cryptohome backed PINs.

Previously, it used to test crypthome PINs only.

- The SetRemove test now also checks that removing PINs has the desired

effect. This check was previously commented out because the UI reports

the PIN as being removed before the removal procedure finishes, so the

check would sometimes be executed before the removal finished. We're

using RunLoop::RunUntilIdle now, which will hopefully reduce flakiness

to negligible probability.

entry.title: Printing: Add debug code for a DispatchBeforePrintEvent() failure
entry.content:
When DispatchBeforePrintEvent() fails its DCHECK(), it is because some

previous caller to DispatchBeforePrintEvent() forgot to call

DispatchAfterPrintEvent(). To figure out who that was, record the line

numbers of all the callers into a queue. Then write the data in the

queue into a crash key. When the DCHECK() crash happens, the crash

report will contain a list of the most recent callers.



Since the crash reports of interest are only available when DCHECK() is

enabled, make the recording code conditional based on DCHECK_IS_ON().

entry.title: [iOS] remove `cancelAction` from `AlertCoordinator`
entry.content:
This property name was misleading.

It seems like it’s related to the ’cancel’ button. That it should be

executed when the alert is cancelled, e.g. when tapping outside of the

alert dismiss it.

Instead, it was only executed in `executeCancelHandler`. Which itself

was used a single time, in a place where noInteractionAction would

perfectly fit the role.

In the `ErrorCoordinator`, `cancelAction` was set, and never used. I

assume it was not the original goal of the author, and given the

function description, I expect that `noInteractionAction` should have

been set instead.



This CL also documents how tapping outside the view interacts with the

coordinator.



Fixed: 1466232

entry.title: Explicitly disable VA-API for Linux V4L2 decoder buildbot
entry.content:
Currently GN will error out if both VA-API and V4L2 are enabled. On x86

w/ X11, VA-API is implicitly enabled by default. This causes problems

for the Linux V4L2 decoder buildbot.



Explicitly disable VA-API for this builder config to avoid this.
